abstracts.value: In this work, the radial Schrödinger equation is solved with the improved Tietz oscillator in the presence of an external magnetic and Aharonov-Bohm (AB) flux fields. By employing the proper quantization rule, analytical equation for bound state energy levels was derived within the framework of Pekeris-type approximation scheme. The expression for the energy levels was used to generate numerical data for some diatomic substances including HF (X $^{1}$Σ$^{+}$), HCl (X $^{1}$Σ$^{+}$), HI (X $^{1}$Σ$^{+}$), CO (X $^{1}$Σ$^{+}$), MgH (X $^{2}$Σ$^{+}$), ICl (A $^{3}$Π$_{1}$), K$_{2}$ (a$^{3}$Σ$_{u}^{+}$), $^{7}$Li$_{2}$ (a$^{3}$Σ$_{u}^{+}$), BrF (X $^{1}$Σ$^{+}$) and BCl (X $^{1}$Σ$^{+}$) molecules. In the absence of the external fields, the mean absolute deviation of the energy levels from experimental data of the molecules are 3.3494%, 2.9210%, 2.8613%, 0.3985%, 4.0886%, 0,9203%, 1.7691%, 0.4850%, 1.0628%, and 0.9010%. The study further reveal that in the absence of the external fields, the obtained energy levels are degenerate. However, if the fields are maintained at about 10 μT, the resulting energy of the molecules is nondegenerate. The results obtained are in good agreement with available literature on diatomic systems.[graphic not available: see fulltext][graphic not available: see fulltext]

titles.title: Energy levels of the improved Tietz oscillator in external magnetic and Aharonov-Bohm flux fields: the Pekeris approximation recipe

keywords.value: light nucleus light nucleus: elastic scattering
elastic scattering: light nucleus light nucleus

abstracts.value: By considering single-step excitation and the consequent de-excitation of a projectile nucleus along with the centre-of-mass pair correlation in a target, the authors derive an analytical expression for the effective N- alpha amplitude for alpha -nucleus scattering. This necessarily results as a correction to the rigid-projectile approximation. They found that the corrections coming from the aforementioned considerations are small in alpha -40Ca and alpha -12C elastic scattering at 1.37 GeV, and thus are unable to explain the success of the phenomenological effective N- alpha amplitude. An expression for the monopole inelastic N- alpha amplitude is also derived in this paper.

titles.title: A Correction to the rigid projectile model
